page.title: 17Travel in Southend
page.content: Transport in Southend is very good, there are green buses and white buses which go all over the town. It is never any problem to get to your destination. Also there is a very good train track from Southend Central to London, calling at Westcliff, Chalkwell and Leigh. During the rush hour the trains run every few minutes, the rest of the time there are about two an hour. Many people commute to London every day from our area, about half go by car and half go by train. Afast train from Southend Central up to London takes about 50 minutes. The railway runs parallel to the old London Road, which is the A13 and part of the time you travel along the shore. Written by Matthew Irons (11yrs)
